reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Not so nice staff
reviews.text: This hotel is a great location to see all the sites of Venice, a bit hard to find (a local kindly pointed us in the right direction). The hotel itself is nice, the rooms are huge by European standards, the bath was huge and nicely appointed. The staff was all business sparing no time for niceties which was sort of a bummer. We checked out on a flood day (barely getting out before the last boat for hours) and the staff was extra stressed. They gave us vague directions to the taxi stand, and were annoyed and rude when my husband came back 5 minutes later to get some clarification.

I booked this hotel for a hen weekend with 11 women and we all had a great time. Out of all 6 rooms none of us had a problem and all seemed very happy. The rooms were very clean, and nice modern bathrooms. I think a couple may have had trouble with the hot water from the shower being intermittent but our room was fine.
reviews.title: Great Stay, Great Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was really lovely with fresh, still warm from the oven, croissants and fresh fruit, cheese & ham, preserves, cereal, tea and coffee. It's a small room though so get down early to avoid having to queue to get in. We were up and out early though because there was so much we wanted to do.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is absolutely great. Less than 5 mins to St. Marks Square and within easy reach of everything. We got a water taxi from the airport direct to the hotel door which was perfect.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, staff is hit-or-miss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One tip....don't have coffee in St. Marks Square. It was a total rip off at about £14 each for just a coffee!
reviews.title: Excellent Location

reviews.text: Location, location, location! This hotel sits on a street just behind all the designer stores, just off St. Marks square. 5 min walk to the square, 10 min walk in the other direction to the Academia bridge. Very safe, with what we experienced as continuous police presence. The rooms were very nice, clean, and baths bigger than I expected. We had two rooms, one for 2, and one for 3, both comfortable and pretty. Breakfast more than adequate, hotel American bar after 4:30. The staff went above and beyond usual service, and did it with grace, promptness, and kindness. I had left my glasses at a restaurant (one of those places you happen across, and swear you could never find again), and the night concierge, with VERY limited info may I add, called around till he located them, and had them secured, along with directions, so I could retrieve them the next day. I was SO appreciative. I booked through Hotels.com, and had no difficulty with the reservation. They also have a private dock - very useful with luggage. I would absolutely stay here again.
reviews.title: Glad I chose this one!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spend 5 nights there and it was very nice. Nothing big and over luxurious but everything was nice and clean.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was very nicely decorated with a spotless bathroom at the the end of a wide corridor. The corridor itself had a spacious closet and a desk.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: Breakfast room was really small, but we always managed to get a table. Breakfast variety was ok, nothing special.
reviews.title: Great location, poky room with over-firm beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best thing about "Kette" is its location!! Just 5 min walk from San Marco Piazza, but still very quiet.
reviews.title: Almost perfect

likes.liked: — Feeling of quality e.g. marble bathroom
likes.disliked: — Room size and view from window

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Kette in August 2007 and the experience was excellent on our first visit to Venice. The hotel was exactly as described on the website and the location was perfect. It isonly 5 minutes walk from St. Mark's Square. We had a room on the fourth floor which was spacious and the bathroom was kept very clean. The room had air-con to keep it cool. However, the best things about our stay were the helpful staff and the plentiful buffet breakfast with a large choice of food. The breakfast room was slightly small but there were always available tables. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent Kette

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having seen the reviews here I was a little nervous about staying at this hotel. I highly recommend this hotel, it is in the best location to see all of what Venice has to offer. I found this hotel to be better than I anticipated. The second floor room (226 with a bath as well as a shower) had the perfect view from two windows, was clean and comfortable and the staff were very helpful. My first trip to Venice and a good hotel helps to make a good holiday.
reviews.title: Great location, great room. Very helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only problem I had was finding the hotel on the first day, I soon realised that I was not alone with this problem, every day I saw people with suitcases and map in hand looking for their hotel and not just the Kette.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, superb staff, fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was perfectly situated, because of my illness I have to rest often so with the hotel being in the centre of everything I could go back during the day for a rest and then set out again in the afternoon. I saw more of Venice than I thought I would be able to and I believe the comfort and position of this hotel was the main factor.
reviews.title: Luke warm on the Kette

likes.disliked: — Pub style breakfast room.....and the breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my first trip to Venice and did not know what to expect. Had been recommended the Kette by travel agent and did not let us down.
reviews.title: Loved this HOTEL!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really lovely and very central hotel. Not far from St Mark's Square and the Campanile. We had a lovely room on the 3rd floor which had two windows looking onto one of the smaller canals. It was lovely in the evening when you were getting ready to go out to leave the shutters open and to hear the gondolas going up and down with people being serenaded and the little lamps to light up the way. Breakfast was lovely but the room tended to get very busy at peak times. No real bar for the evening but loads of bars, restaurants etc nearby.
reviews.title: Lovely, Romantic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at the Kette and were delighted with it. Our choice had a lot to do with the hotel being in a quiet area. When we arrived earlier than the regular check-in time our room was ready. The hotel knew we wanted a quiet room and mentioned it was not on the canal for that reason which was fine with us. Yes, the room was small but in terms of large cities it was fine with a bathroom that had bathtub with a shower and a glass door versus the usual shower curtain. The bed was comfortable but I did bring my own pillow after reading about pillows being hard in Italy and I was glad I did. The breakfast room was small as noted in reviews but we always found a seat and there was plenty of choice in food. We had no trouble finding the hotel from
reviews.title: excellent choice

likes.liked: — The location and the quiet room
likes.disliked: — There was furniture to allow us to unpack.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the map on the web site and the location is excellent. We would stay here again. In tems of Venice the price of food is shockingly high and everywhere else in Italy seems a bargin. The most important thing is to get to the remote areas where the locals live to really enjoy the feel of Venice away from the crowds.
reviews.title: Hotel Kette, Venice

reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights and found the hotel to be clean, centrally placed and ideal for walking round Venice. Approximately 5 minutes from the San Marco drop off for the airport public water taxi, the hotel was easy to find and located in a nice area. Also around 5 minutes from San Marco so just far enough away to avoid the hustle and bustle of the crowds. Don't be disappointed with the lack of views around the hotel - not many of the hotels in Venice have views. Our room (416) was quiet and of a reasonable size. The hotel has two lifts so no problems getting up and down. Stay clear of San Marco when looking for places to eat - head to Dorsoduro and find one of the many street cafes and don't be frightened to head down small narrow alleys - great fun to explore and amazing what you see.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Kette was a perfect small hotel. The staff was professional and educated in all aspects of the area - restaurants, etc - which was helpful. The room had nice quality linens, decor and a comfortable bed. The bathroom was also modern and clean. The room and bathroom were by no means large but that is to be expected in most cities. It was large enough for us not to feel cramped. The other great aspect was the location. It was around the corner from all of the shops, but in a quiet area. I would absolutely stay there again! And be ready...Venice is quite expensive. Gondola rides are 100 euros for 30 minutes. We also took a water taxi ride for 10 minutes that cost 70 euros. They were both amazing and worth it. The budget-conscious can stick to the water bus, or by foot, which is what we did and a great way to explor!
reviews.title: Just an average stay...
